page.title: 06St.Mary's Church,Riccall
page.content: Saint Mary's Church was built by the Normans in the 11th cent. (1069). The church is near the Hawthorns and the church hall.The church has its own grave yard.The church has a tower on which waves the Saint George's flag In side it has a small pulpit for preaching and a book holder for the bible . Many of the windows are stained glass showing Jesus and the saints. There are special seats for the choir to sit in. The walls are made of stone.The roof of timber covered in slate.On the tower there is a clock with a loud bell. The present vicar's name is Mr. Peter Wood.
